Line 106: Line 106:
==Student life==
==Student life==
===Athletics===
===Athletics===
  +
[[File:Maryland-easternshore.png|thumb|right|Athletics logo]]
UMES athletic teams compete in the [[Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference]]. The school was once a powerhouse in black college [[American football|football]], producing five undefeated seasons between 1947 and 1960, but like many smaller [[colleges]], the high costs associated with operating a [[Division I]] football program and complying with [[Title IX]] became too much of a burden, and the team was shut down after the 1979 season. In 1948, the University of Maryland Eastern Shore (UMES) and Albright College played the first intercollegiate football game between an Historical Black Colleges and Universities (HBCU) institution and a majority-white institution.<ref>{{cite web | title = Vernon "Skip" McCain/UMES Football Reinstatement Fund Second Quarter 2007 Report | url = http://www.umes.edu/football/Second%20Quarter%202007%20VSM%20Fund%20Annual%20Report.doc | accessdate = August 17, 2009}}</ref>
UMES athletic teams compete in the [[Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference]]. The school was once a powerhouse in black college [[American football|football]], producing five undefeated seasons between 1947 and 1960, but like many smaller [[colleges]], the high costs associated with operating a [[Division I]] football program and complying with [[Title IX]] became too much of a burden, and the team was shut down after the 1979 season. In 1948, the University of Maryland Eastern Shore (UMES) and Albright College played the first intercollegiate football game between an Historical Black Colleges and Universities (HBCU) institution and a majority-white institution.<ref>{{cite web | title = Vernon "Skip" McCain/UMES Football Reinstatement Fund Second Quarter 2007 Report | url = http://www.umes.edu/football/Second%20Quarter%202007%20VSM%20Fund%20Annual%20Report.doc | accessdate = August 17, 2009}}</ref>
NFL player and coach [[Art Shell]] attended UMES.
NFL player and coach [[Art Shell]] attended UMES.
